alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 1:43PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HENRY...NORTHEASTERN HOUSTON AND SOUTHWESTERN EARLY COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT/215 PM CDT/... At 243 PM EDT/143 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Blakely to near Columbia. This storm is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blakely, Webb, Columbia, Haleburg, Howards Mill, Sigma, Pearce, Rock Hill, Pleasant Plains, Farley Nuclear Plant, Cedar Springs, Hilton, and Sawhatchee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
